author: Colon Wrecker
content: Bullish: NVDA is the last big hurdle for the market. Now the market can focus on the Thanksgiving and end of the year melt up! 🚀

author: Real comments
content: Bullish: Cramer: If AMZN grows its EPS by an average of 25% annually like now, over the next three years, it will achieve an EPS of around $9.25, what suggests a fair stock value over $300

author: dunkleman
content: Just a garbage stock…continues to be in weak hands.

author: Kali
content: Bearish on AMZN short-term. Too many macro headwinds and weak volume on rallies. Waiting for a better entry below $190.

author: Gabriella
content: Amazon Haul is interesting, but is it really gonna compete with Temu? They’re late to the game. Feels like a desperation move.

author: Lily
content: AMZN needs to reinvest in same-day delivery. It used to feel revolutionary, but now Walmart’s catching up. Competitive edge is shrinking.

author: Jaime
content: Black Friday will pump this stock, no doubt. But what happens after the holiday sugar rush? Long-term story feels murky lately.

author: Victoria
content: Why is nobody talking about Amazon Ads? It’s growing faster than most ad platforms, and margins are insane. This is an underappreciated gem.

author: Grace
content: Bezos dumping shares again? Makes me nervous. Insiders usually know more than retail. Might trim some of my position here.

author: Joe D
content: Finishing in red. Jassey is lame and needs to pay a dividend.
